name: 25th Anniversary of the November Constitution
obverse: Head of Christian IX facing right.
obverse_inscriptions: MED GUD FOR ÆRE OG RET
reverse_inscriptions: * 1863-1888 SOM KLIPPEN VÆRNER MOD FOSSENS FALD, AT TRYGT MAN I DAG KAN BYGGE, SAA STOD DU FAST VED DIT KONGEKALD AT VÆRNE OM DANMARKS LYKKE. V. BERGSØE
description: The November Constitution was signed in 1863 and created a join parliament to govern the affairs of Denmark and Schleswig.
This was an attempt by Denmark to bring Schleswig under its control and incited Germany to start the Second Schleswig War.
The inscription 'MED GUD FOR ÆRE OG RET' was the royal motto of Christian IX and means 'With God for honour and justice'.
